title: How to see all my comments on idb file
content:
I add some comments to exe file with ida(save on idb).
Is there any simple way how to see all my comments in 1 windows?

answers_data.content:
What you want is IDA Marker. 
Alt+M to make a marked comment at current cursor location
Ctrl+M to bring up a window showing all marked comments

comments.text: That help if I already marked ... I have lot of comments tgat I not narked, and I want to watch them all
Script it. Interface with IDAPython to iterate every single instruction and use GetCommentEx to see if there's already a comment there. If there is, print out the address, instruction, and comment
I had never do it, can you tell me please how to do it/ link me to place that explain same thing??
Just Google for IDAPython tutorials. The only prior knowledge u need is Python

I'm amazed there isn't just a "Comments" dialog that has a list of your comments. If you've commented against a line you're instinctively quite likely to want to go back there. Especially considering the eyewatering price of IDA this seems like a basic feature that's lacking.
